intro: Pilosella agathantha, commonly known as the whiteleaf mouseear, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and herbaceous growth habit. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands. Its leaves are narrow, hairy, and often have a silvery appearance, while the flowers are small and white or pale yellow. Pilosella agathantha is generally drought-tolerant and thrives in regions with mild, temperate climates.
